title: GeeksforGeeks Student Chapter | SRM IST, Kattankulathur
author: Aayush Rai
description: An overview of the GeeksforGeeks Student Chapter at SRM IST, Kattankulathur, including its mission, events, opportunities, achievements, and how to join.
content:
## **Introduction**
The **GeeksforGeeks Student Chapter at SRM Institute of Science and Technology, Kattankulathur** is a vibrant and active coding community dedicated to helping students **enhance their problem-solving skills**, **learn development**, and **prepare for placements**. Our mission is to create a collaborative space for students to **learn, build, and grow** in the field of technology.

---

## **About the Chapter**
- **Founded At:** SRM IST, Kattankulathur
- **Objective:** Build a strong coding culture and bridge the gap between academics and industry.
- **Community Strength:** 500+ active members
- **Focus Areas:** DSA, Web Development, AI/ML, Competitive Programming, and Interview Preparation.

---

## **Mission & Vision**
- **Learn by Doing:** Hands-on workshops, live coding sessions, and projects.
- **Prepare for Placements:** Focused on DSA, problem-solving, and mock interviews.
- **Build Together:** Encourage collaborative projects and open-source contributions.
- **Stay Updated:** Industry talks and sessions with experienced developers and alumni.

---

## **Events & Programs**
### **💻 Technical Workshops**
- Beginner to advanced sessions on **DSA, Web Development, AI/ML**, and **Next.js**.
- Hands-on labs to implement concepts in real-time.

### **🏆 Coding Contests**
- Monthly coding challenges and hackathons.
- Problem-solving practice on the **GeeksforGeeks platform**.

### **🎤 Expert Talks**
- Sessions conducted by **industry professionals, SRM alumni, and GfG experts**.
- Insights on internships, product-based companies, and competitive programming.

### **🤝 Peer-to-Peer Mentorship**
- Small cohort-based mentorship led by senior students.
- One-on-one doubt-solving sessions and personalized guidance.

---

## **How to Join**
Becoming a part of the **GfG Student Chapter** is simple and **completely free**:
- **Step 1:** Fill out the official registration form (released at the start of every semester).
- **Step 2:** Join the WhatsApp/Discord group for updates.
- **Step 3:** Attend the orientation and choose your preferred track.

> Walk-in registrations are also available for selected events and bootcamps.

---

## **Core Team & Roles**
- **President & Vice-President:** Manage chapter strategy and collaborations.
- **Tech Leads:** Lead DSA, development, and AI/ML programs.
- **Events Team:** Organize workshops, hackathons, and contests.
- **Content & Design Team:** Create event posters, blogs, and social media content.
- **Sponsorship & Outreach Team:** Build partnerships with companies and other clubs.

> **Recruitments** happen once every semester through forms, short tasks, and interviews.

---

## **Achievements**
- **500+ participants** in coding bootcamps and workshops.
- Alumni placed in **MAANG, Oracle, Atlassian, Razorpay, Zomato**, and other top tech companies.
- Conducted **15+ successful workshops** and **6 hackathons** in the past year.
- Community-built open-source tools and templates shared via GitHub.

---

## **Upcoming Event Calendar (Odd Semester 2025)**
- **Week 1:** Orientation + Git & GitHub Workshop
- **Week 2–5:** DSA Bootcamp — Arrays, Strings, Hashing, Two Pointers
- **Week 6–9:** Advanced DSA — Trees, Graphs, DP
- **Week 10:** Web Development Sprint — Next.js + APIs
- **Week 11:** HackSRM — 24-hour hackathon
- **Week 12:** Placement Prep Series — Mock Interviews & Resume Reviews

---

## **Conclusion**
The **GeeksforGeeks Student Chapter at SRM IST, KTR** is more than just a club — it's a **community of passionate learners** working together to become better engineers. Whether you're a beginner looking to learn DSA or a senior preparing for placements, GfG SRM offers **resources, mentorship, and opportunities** to help you grow.

> "Code. Collaborate. Conquer."

title: My Journey as a CSE Student | Aayush Rai
author: Aayush Rai
description: A detailed look into my academic journey, achievements, and profile as a CSE student specializing in AIML.
content:
## **Introduction**
Hi, I'm **Aayush Rai**, a passionate **Computer Science and Engineering** student specializing in **Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AIML)** at **SRM University, Kattankulathur**. My aim is to become a skilled software engineer and build a strong technical foundation during my B.Tech.

---

## **Academic Journey**
- **Schooling:** Completed my 12th grade from **Birla Public School, Pilani** in **April 2024**.
- **12th Percentage:** **91.2%** in **PCM**.
- **Current Course:** Pursuing **B.Tech in CSE (AIML)** at **SRM University**.
- **Year:** 2nd Year (2025)
- **First-Year CGPA:** **9.51 / 10**

---

## **Achievements & Roles**
### **🎓 Academic Achievements**
- Scored **91.2%** in **Class 12 (PCM)**.
- Secured **9.51 CGPA** in the **first year** of B.Tech.
- Consistently ranked among the top students in academics.

### **🏅 Leadership & Extracurriculars**
- Served as the **Academic Prefect** at Birla Public School, Pilani, leading academic activities and mentoring peers.
- **Hosted and anchored multiple events and functions**, including cultural programs, school assemblies, and annual functions.
- Actively participated in debates, presentations, and technical workshops.

### **💻 Technical Skills**
- **Languages:** C, C++, Python, JavaScript
- **Web Development:** Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS, Node.js
- **Databases:** MySQL, MongoDB
- **Specialization:** Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

---

## **GATE CSE 2027 Preparation**
I have started preparing for **GATE CSE 2027** as a long-term academic objective. Right now I’m focusing on strengthening core CS fundamentals, especially:
- **Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA)**
- **Operating Systems (OS)**
- **Computer Organization & Architecture (COA)**
- **Discrete Mathematics**

 While GATE is on the roadmap, my immediate priority is solidifying fundamentals and building practical projects.

---

## **Conclusion**
My journey so far has been about **hard work, consistency, and balanced growth**—from strong academic results to leadership and hosting events. I’m committed to learning continuously and applying my skills to real projects and challenges.

> "Dream big, work hard, and stay consistent. Success will follow."

title: Building REST APIs with Next.js & Tailwind CSS
author: Aayush Rai
description: Learn how to build RESTful API routes in Next.js with a beautiful Tailwind CSS UI.
content:
## Steps

**__1. Setting up a Next.js Project__**
- Install Next.js using `npx create-next-app`
- Configure Tailwind CSS for styling
- Setup folder structure for `pages/api`

**__2. Creating API Routes__**
- Use the `/pages/api` folder to define endpoints
- Example: `/pages/api/posts.js`
```js
export default function handler(req, res) {
  res.status(200).json({ message: 'API working!' });
}
```

**__3. Integrating Tailwind CSS__**
- Use utility classes for quick UI design
- Example: `<button class="bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded">Submit</button>`

**__4. Fetching Data from API__**
- Use `fetch()` or SWR hooks to get API data
```js
const { data } = useSWR('/api/posts', fetcher);
```

**Pro Tip:** Use **SWR** for optimized data fetching and caching.

title: React Performance Optimization Techniques
author: Aayush Rai
description: Boost your React app's performance using advanced optimization strategies.
content:
## Techniques

**__1. Code Splitting with React.lazy__**
- Load components **only when needed**
```js
const Dashboard = React.lazy(() => import('./Dashboard'));
```

**__2. Memoization with React.memo__**
- Prevents unnecessary re-renders
```js
const MemoizedButton = React.memo(Button);
```

**__3. useCallback & useMemo__**
- Optimize heavy computations and functions
```js
const expensiveValue = useMemo(() => calculateHeavy(), []);
const handleClick = useCallback(() => setCount(count + 1), [count]);
```

**__4. Avoid Unnecessary Re-renders__**
- Use `key` wisely and keep components pure

**Note:** Use **React Profiler** in DevTools to identify performance bottlenecks.
